alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 26 at 1:19PM PST until December 29 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with dangerous rip currents. Local max sets to 9 feet possible Wednesday. Highest surf on west-facing beaches. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
